# Siamese invasion of Patani (1786)

Patani Kingdom
| commander1        =  Rama I (King Phutthayotfa Chulalok)
| commander2        =  Sultan Muhammad
| strength1         = Unknown
| strength2         = Unknown
| casualties1       = Unknown
| casualties2       = Unknown
}}
The Siamese invasion of Patani occurred as part of the expansion and unification of the Siamese kingdom during the reign of King Buddha Yodfa Chulalok the Great (Rama I) of the Rattanakosin period Siam led an army to attack Pattani until it was defeated, with Prince Maha Sura Singhanat as the commander. Pattani lost its independence at this time. Siamese soldiers burned the palace and houses, including seizing two important cannons, namely Sri Na Kue Ree and Sri Patani.
